place.name: BRANDISTON
place.gazetteerText: BRANDESTONE, or Brandistone, a parish in St. Faith district, Norfolk; 3 miles SE of Reepham, 6 W of the projected railway from Norwich to Cromer, and 11 NW by N of Norwich. Post Town, Booton, under Norwich. Acres, 764. Real property, £1,466. Pop., 181. Houses, 35. The property is divided among five. Brandeston Hall belonged formerly to the Atthills. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £180.* Patron, Magdalene College, Oxford. The church is good; and there are a national school, and charities £23. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
